net.openhft.chronicle.map

Class MapEventListener<K,V>

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.openhft.chronicle.map.MapEventListener<K,V>
  • Type Parameters:
    K - key type of the maps, trackable by this event listener
    V - value type of the maps, trackable by this event listener
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable

    public abstract class MapEventListener<K,V>
extends Object
implements Serializable
    Contains methods which are called when ChronicleMap key events occur. Typical use cases:
    • Map data backup / replication.
    • Logging, monitoring, debugging.

    This is an adapter class - all methods have default implementations as no-ops. Extend this class and override only methods corresponding the events you are interested in.

    To configure MapEventListener for ChronicleMap, use AbstractChronicleMapBuilder.eventListener(MapEventListener) method.

    See logging(String) implementation.

    All these calls are synchronous while a ChronicleMap lock is held so make them as quick as possible.

    The entry passed to the methods is Bytes instance positioned at meta data area. See ChronicleHashBuilder.metaDataBytes(int) for more information.

    See Also:
    AbstractChronicleMapBuilder.eventListener(MapEventListener), Serialized Form

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static <K,V> MapEventListener<K,V> logging(String prefix)
      Returns the map event listener, which logs strings like "map file opType key value", where opType is either "get", "put" or "remove", to the logger provided by SLF4J.
      void onGetFound(K key, V foundValue)
      This method is called if the key is found in the map during get, getUsing or acquireUsing method call.
      void onPut(K key, V newValue, V replacedValue)
      This method is called whenever a new value is put for the key in the map during calls of such methods as put, putIfAbsent, replace, etc.
      void onRemove(K key, V value)
      This is called when an entry is removed.

    • Method Detail

      • logging

        public static <K,V> MapEventListener<K,V> logging(String prefix)
        Returns the map event listener, which logs strings like "map file opType key value", where opType is either "get", "put" or "remove", to the logger provided by SLF4J.
        Type Parameters:
        K - the map key type
        V - the map value type
        Parameters:
        prefix - logging prefix
        Returns:
        the logging event listener

      • onGetFound

        public void onGetFound(K key,
              V foundValue)
        This method is called if the key is found in the map during get, getUsing or acquireUsing method call.
        Parameters:
        key - the key looked up
        foundValue - the value found for the key

      • onPut

        public void onPut(K key,
         V newValue,
         @Nullable
         V replacedValue)
        This method is called whenever a new value is put for the key in the map during calls of such methods as put, putIfAbsent, replace, etc. When a new value is default for the map or obtained during acquireUsing call is put for the key, this method is called as well.

        This method is called when put is already happened.

        Parameters:
        key - the key the given value is put for
        newValue - the value which is now associated with the given key
        replacedValue - the value which was replaced by newValue, null if the key was absent in the map before current ChronicleMap

      • onRemove

        public void onRemove(K key,
            V value)
        This is called when an entry is removed. Misses, i. e. when map.remove(key) is called, but key is already absent in the map, are not notified.
        Parameters:
        key - the key removed from the map
        value - the value which was associated with the given key
